title: Why is interdisciplinary education so important? - Quora

response.answer_text: Interdisciplinary education allows students to major in one discipline and takes up minors in a completely different discipline. Students do not need to necessarily major and minor in the same discipline. They can pursue their interests. This helps them in developing a diverse approach, which is the ultimate need of today’s industry and is going to further rise by the next decade exponentially. By multidisciplinary approach, one will not be entering a career that lasts a lifetime but a lifetime of multiple careers.

Each academic discipline has a partial perspective on the world. The disciplines together are like Voltron. Together they are stronger than they are apart. Each of the disciplines add something to the human experience and knowledge base. Each is capable of providing progress in its own way: HistoryArtsEthicsPhilosophyPsychologyArt & DesignLiteratureAnthropoogySociologyLeadershipEducationCommunicationEach has a role to play in our interdependent, mosaic of a culture.
